alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Phelps, Gosper, Furnas and Harlan Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 114 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Overton to near Bertrand to near Arapahoe to 9 miles north of Indianola. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Arapahoe, Bertrand and Loomis around 120 AM CDT. Edison around 125 AM CDT. Atlanta around 130 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Holdrege, Oxford, Beaver City, Hollinger, Funk, Stamford, Orleans, Wilsonville, Huntley and Alma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
